channel.title: Explorer.exe won't stay! (Still not fixed)
channel.description: Well my explorer.exe just won't stay on the process list. It somehow keeps getting deleted. It stays on for a split second, then BAM! It's gone. Can anybody help me p10x?

item.title: Explorer.exe won't stay! (Still not fixed)
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

The computer manufacture should have provided you with disks that are available if you need to restore drivers, and other necessary things. Check on those disks. If that doesn’t help contact your computers manufacture. They will know how to fix this problem.

Leader

Read full topic

item.title: Explorer.exe won't stay! (Still not fixed)
item.dc:creator: @Taylor Taylor
item.description:
@Taylor wrote:

pop in the xp cd and try recovery console or something

Read full topic

item.title: Explorer.exe won't stay! (Still not fixed)
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

[quote=“leader, post:20, topic:15023”]Alright, I have the solution to your problem.

Do you have any other users on your account? If you don’t then log onto the administrator during safe mode. Once on the administrator, save all your important documents and things you want to keep in a folder. Then go to the control panel on the administrator. The administrator should have a control panel because you don’t use that account often. Remake your account from there.

Hope that helped.

Your friend,
Leader[/quote]
I can’t get onto control pannel without Explorer.exe

[quote=“Nerice, post:22, topic:15023”]dlp.dll you want to get rid of, wont fix your problem, but will keep you from getting other stuff.

Gateways suck, toss it out the window anyway.[/quote]Not a gateway lol

Read full topic

–C:\Program Files\TortoiseSVN\bin\TSVNCache.exe

–O4 - HKLM…\Run: [SetDefPrt] “C:\Program Files\Brother\Brmfl04b\BrStDvPt.exe”

–O4 - HKLM…\Run: [VIPv3_Auto_Update] C:\WINDOWS\VIPv3\CheckForUpdates.exe
–O4 - HKCU…\RunOnce: [SpySweeperUninstallSurvey] http://products.webroot.com/disp0201.php?pc=64021&rc=5025&ps=T&oc=33&mjv=5&mnv=0&bld=1286&cd=&dcc=&drc=&mo=&sid=1880327063&lang=en&loc=USA&opi=2&omj=5&omn=1&rsc=

Those Brothers Processes are an Printer I have the same one.

Read full topic

item.title: Explorer.exe won't stay! (Still not fixed)
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

Alright, I have the solution to your problem.

Do you have any other users on your account? If you don’t then log onto the administrator during safe mode. Once on the administrator, save all your important documents and things you want to keep in a folder. Then go to the control panel on the administrator. The administrator should have a control panel because you don’t use that account often. Remake your account from there.

Hope that helped.

Your friend,
Leader

Read full topic

item.title: Explorer.exe won't stay! (Still not fixed)
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:

–O2 - BHO: CDLPObj Object - {BE2ED590-CA49-46B5-8CCE-244FB2E0D1AA} - C:WINDOWSDLP.dll

–O23 - Service: Brother Popup Suspend service for Resource manager (brmfrmps) - Unknown owner - C:WINDOWSsystem32Brmfrmps.exe" -service (file missing)[/quote]
Nah those are virus scanners, and my printer and stuff.

item.title: Explorer.exe won't stay! (Still not fixed)
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

It looks clean, but check these, and click “fixed check” if you want(Not required.):
R0 - HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Main,Local Page =
R0 - HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Main,Local Page =

What anti-virus program do you have? If any…

Read full topic

item.title: Explorer.exe won't stay! (Still not fixed)
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[quote=“bullzeye, post:12, topic:15023”]I have today off from school

Hmm… Wow scrss.exe goes to 5% computer usage when it crashes! But I can’t end it.[/quote]
Go to your startup registry, and disable it. Start—>Run—>msconfig—>Ok—>Startup—>scrss.exe

If that doesn’t work, download http://www.download.com/HijackThis/3000-8022_4-10379544.html, and save it somewhere. Do not run it from your temporary internet files, it will not run correctly. You must save it somewhere. After you have it saved somewhere, run it.

Post the log here, and I can help you.

Description: scrss.exe is a process which is registered as the HacDef-R Trojan. This Trojan allows attackers to access your computer from remote locations, stealing passwords, Internet banking and personal data. This process is a security risk and should be removed from your system.

Read full topic
